RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlSubmitForm

RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlSubmitForm Class Reference

#include <curlsubmitform.h>

Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlSubmitForm:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A class used to fill a form and submit it.

In this class, the controlBefore() and controlAfter() are very important. If you add a player, you use setPlayerName() and others to correctly fill the POST datas and call the perform() function.

The controlBefore function will be called, the postedData variable will be initialized by the call of computePostedData(), the post is done and we call controlAfter to see if all the changes are done.

If you override controlBefore(), controlAfter() and computePostedData(), you don't have to override perform().

In a subclass, You can use setPostedData(const char* , const char* ) to post a value for a regular key. Instead use setPostedPwd(const char* , const char*) to post the password of the user. Use setCustomPost(const char* , const char* ) if the key does not yet exist.

After setting all the data to post, call perform() to submit the form.

The end-user of a subclass should not use setPostedData and cie, he may use accessor in the subclass (setName, setPwd...)

See also:
CurlPostedData

Member Function Documentation

bool RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlSubmitForm::perform (  )  [virtual]

The function to call to performed operation.

it successively calls controlBefore, computePostedData, submitForm and controlAfter.

Returns:
true if all operations are successful, otherwise returns false.

Implements RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlInterface.

Definition at line 188 of file curlsubmitform.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlSubmitForm::setCustomPost ( const char *  key,
const char *  value 
) [protected]

Used to post some custom key and value.

This method is used to add a key and a value at the same time. If you know the key does not exist, call this. It simply call CurlPostedData::addKey(const char*) and CurlPostedData::setValue(const char* key, const char* val) with the given parameters.

This is intended to do not warn up the user for a not-needed key. If a key is facultative, use it.

Parameters:
key The key to add
value The password
See also:
CurlPostedData

const char *  value 
) [protected]

Used to add a key/value pair to post.

It simply calls setValue to the CurlPostedData instance.

Parameters:
key The key to fill
value The value to set to the given key

void RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlInterface::setCustomErrorMessage ( const char *  msg  )  [protected, inherited]

Set a new custom error message.

Only one custom error message can be set, so the second time you call this, a warning log is sent but the message is not modified.

Parameters:

Definition at line 122 of file curlinterface.h.

long RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlInterface::serverResponse [protected, inherited]

The response of the server to the last perform.

It is the server response : 404 says Page not found... The default value is set in CurlInterface's default constructor : -1. This value indicates that no server action was performed.

First test this value, and if you get -1, see customErrorMessage.

Definition at line 137 of file curlinterface.h.

const char* RainbruRPG::Network::Ident::CurlInterface::customErrorMessage [protected, inherited]

If an error occured during a custom operation, fill in this message.

Do not set this directly. Use setCustomErrorMessage instead which test if a message already exits.
